docs.snippet: Bohumil Hrabal, who was widely regarded as the grand old man of Czech literature and whose novella ''Closely Watched Trains'' became an Oscar-winning film, died on Monday in a fall from a Prague hospital building. He was 82.    A hospital spokesma...
docs.lead_paragraph: Bohumil Hrabal, who was widely regarded as the grand old man of Czech literature and whose novella ''Closely Watched Trains'' became an Oscar-winning film, died on Monday in a fall from a Prague hospital building. He was 82. A hospital spokesman said he was being treated for severe arthritis at the hospital and fell from a fifth-floor window as he tried to feed birds, Reuters reported.
docs.abstract: Bohumil Hrabal, who was widely regarded as grand old man of Czech literature, dies at age 82; photo (M)

headline.main: Bohumil Hrabal, 82, Who Defied Censors in Wry Tales of Ordinary Czechs

docs.snippet: This article was sent from a location outside Mexico City where the reporter and five other journalists were taken blindfolded on Tuesday to interview rebel leaders.    The guerrillas of the Popular Revolutionary Army made a spectacular military d...
docs.lead_paragraph: This article was sent from a location outside Mexico City where the reporter and five other journalists were taken blindfolded on Tuesday to interview rebel leaders. The guerrillas of the Popular Revolutionary Army made a spectacular military debut in August 1996 by mounting coordinated attacks in six states in one day.
docs.abstract: Three commanders of Popular Revolutionary Army, in clandestine news conference outside Mexico City, say they believe their movement is gaining support and that they are planning long-term resistance against Mexican Government; photo (M)

headline.main: Mexican Rebels Vow a Long, Hard Battle

docs.snippet: Next fall, moviegoers may do a double take when, for the second time this year, a film about the late track star Steve Prefontaine will be released.    The Disney version, ''Prefontaine'' is in movie theaters now, directed by Steve James and co-pr...
docs.lead_paragraph: Next fall, moviegoers may do a double take when, for the second time this year, a film about the late track star Steve Prefontaine will be released. The Disney version, ''Prefontaine'' is in movie theaters now, directed by Steve James and co-produced by Peter Gilbert, who made ''Hoop Dreams.''
docs.abstract: Article discusses two motion pictures being made about career of late runner Steve Prefontaine; photo (M)

docs.snippet: ''This is getting too nice,'' Oscar the Grouch finally grumbled on ''The Rosie O'Donnell Show'' today, after Hillary Rodham Clinton had finished warbling about ''goin' steady,'' and chortling about getting kissed on the cheek by Tom Cruise, and sh...
docs.lead_paragraph: ''This is getting too nice,'' Oscar the Grouch finally grumbled on ''The Rosie O'Donnell Show'' today, after Hillary Rodham Clinton had finished warbling about ''goin' steady,'' and chortling about getting kissed on the cheek by Tom Cruise, and showing off a picture of herself in ponytail and pink poodle skirt at a White House 50's party in the arms of ''my handsome husband.'' Mrs. Clinton amply demonstrated today the quality that her old friends and White House aides universally ascribe to her: complexity. On the same day that she made her confectionary appearance on Ms. O'Donnell's syndicated show, which was taped last week, she delivered a speech at a development conference here, declaring: ''Microcredit is an invaluable tool in alleviating poverty, promoting self-sufficiency and stimulating economic activity.''
docs.abstract: First Lady Hillary Rodham Clinton appears on Rosie O'Donnell television talk show, part of her more public re-emergence since end of Presidential campaign; photo (M)

headline.main: First Lady Talks of Mice and Men on 'Rosie' Show

docs.snippet: When MIA FARROW's memoirs go on sale tomorrow, what revelations can readers expect? Is there anything new to be learned about her relationship with Woody Allen, which ended so bitterly, about her marriages to Frank Sinatra and Andre Previn, about ...
docs.lead_paragraph: When MIA FARROW's memoirs go on sale tomorrow, what revelations can readers expect? Is there anything new to be learned about her relationship with Woody Allen, which ended so bitterly, about her marriages to Frank Sinatra and Andre Previn, about her rise to stardom or her 14 children? No one connected with the book, ''What Falls Away,'' is saying, and the publisher, Nan A. Talese/Doubleday, is not releasing any copies until tomorrow. But NAN TALESE, its editor, predicted that readers would be surprised by its literary quality.
docs.abstract: Editor Nan Talese to host publication party for memoirs of Mia Farrow; book is titled What Falls Away (S)

docs.snippet: It could be argued that nearly every major designer breakthrough of the last 50 years has been based on a new take on the suit.    Prada had one. Gucci had one. And well before the 1990's, so did Giorgio Armani, Chanel and Christian Dior. All of t...
docs.lead_paragraph: It could be argued that nearly every major designer breakthrough of the last 50 years has been based on a new take on the suit. Prada had one. Gucci had one. And well before the 1990's, so did Giorgio Armani, Chanel and Christian Dior. All of the greatest designers have a suit signature. John Galliano's is long and fluid; Karl Lagerfeld's has a hint of German Expressionism, with slim shoulders but sharp angled collars and squared buttons.
docs.abstract: Amy M Spindler reviews women's fashions from French designers that are presented at Paris fashion shows; photo (M)

docs.snippet: MARISA TOMEI KEEPS HER Oscar on the dressing table in the bathroom of her Greenwich Village apartment, right next to the Vavoom hair gel and vanilla body mist. ''It was a peak moment in my life, definitely,'' says the 32-year-old actress.    She c...
docs.lead_paragraph: MARISA TOMEI KEEPS HER Oscar on the dressing table in the bathroom of her Greenwich Village apartment, right next to the Vavoom hair gel and vanilla body mist. ''It was a peak moment in my life, definitely,'' says the 32-year-old actress. She can remember every detail about the evening in 1993 when she was named best supporting actress for her performance in ''My Cousin Vinny.'' On her way to the stage, she, in gauzy black-and-white Chanel, stumbled briefly but didn't fall. Later, she hugged and air-kissed her way through a blur of exclusive parties. The night ended perfectly, at 4 A.M., in the apartment of two old friends who hadn't been able to make it to the ceremony.
docs.abstract: Interview with Marisa Tomei, who appears in film Unhook the Stars, on her career since winning Oscar for best supporting actress in 1993; photos (L)

headline.main: Vinny's Girlfriend, Climbing Back After Success

docs.snippet: AT THE SUNDANCE FILM FESTIVAL, it was hard to walk down the street or negotiate your way through a party without being mowed down by a camera crew. Park City was full of them, but they weren't making movies; they were trying to mint new celebritie...
docs.lead_paragraph: AT THE SUNDANCE FILM FESTIVAL, it was hard to walk down the street or negotiate your way through a party without being mowed down by a camera crew. Park City was full of them, but they weren't making movies; they were trying to mint new celebrities. ABC's ''Good Morning America'' was trailing Morgan J. Freeman (no relation to the actor), the director of ''Hurricane,'' an adolescent angst movie that went on to tie for this year's Audience Award. MSNBC was following the three partners in October Films, whose non-Sundance movies ''Secrets and Lies'' and ''Breaking the Waves'' are contenders for Oscar nominations.
docs.abstract: Sundance Film Festival, Park City, Utah, while continuing to focus on small independent films, has emerged as major movie venue, turning filmmakers into instant celebrities; Hollywood, in part because of festival's influence, has embraced independent films as never before; photos (L)

headline.main: Hollywood Breathes In The Spirit of Sundance

docs.snippet: Jennifer Leigh Abramson, the daughter of the late Lois Abramson and the late Oscar Abramson, was married last evening to Dr. Jeffrey S. Rosenberg, a son of Maxine and Dr. Dan Rosenberg of West Chester, Pa. Rabbi David Glandsberg-Kranin performed t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jennifer Leigh Abramson, the daughter of the late Lois Abramson and the late Oscar Abramson, was married last evening to Dr. Jeffrey S. Rosenberg, a son of Maxine and Dr. Dan Rosenberg of West Chester, Pa. Rabbi David Glandsberg-Kranin performed the ceremony at the Mendenhall Inn in Mendenhall, Pa. Ms. Abramson-Rosenberg, 25, is a medical student at Mount Sinai School of Medicine, from which the bridegroom received his M.D. She graduated magna cum laude from Barnard College. Her father was an agent with the Taylor & Taylor Insurance Company in New York.

docs.snippet: Dolls, Darling, Dolls    ''SONJA HENIE is in the wrong category,'' Maureen Herrod said as she touched a faded ice-skating skirt. ''She shouldn't be with John Wayne, Fred Astaire and Marilyn Monroe.'' Sonja was more an antique, Ms. Herrod decided. ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Dolls, Darling, Dolls ''SONJA HENIE is in the wrong category,'' Maureen Herrod said as she touched a faded ice-skating skirt. ''She shouldn't be with John Wayne, Fred Astaire and Marilyn Monroe.'' Sonja was more an antique, Ms. Herrod decided. But it was too late. Sonja, a doll, had been judged with the dolls of John, Fred and Marilyn in the ''Movie Star Adult Division.'' The winner was, who else, John Wayne.
docs.abstract: Article on annual doll competition sponsored by Patchogue Doll Fanciers Club of Long Island, NY; grand prize winner was china doll from 1860's owned by Karen D'Onofrio of Holbrook, NY; photos (L)

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: DOLL DANCIERS CLUB OF LONG ISLAND
